repnme.cdata!:
India - Gujarat State Highway Project, and
            Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Gujarat State Highway
            Project for India were as follows: outcome was highly
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was negligible to
            low; Bank performance was satisfactory; and borrower
            performance was highly satisfactory. Ratings for the
            Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project for India were
            as follows: outcome was moderately satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was moderate; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory; and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the
            physical and financial sustainability of a road network
            hinges on the road agency's capacity to undertake
            needs-based and timely implementation of road improvement
            and maintenance works. This enables optimal use of available
            funds, and avoids greater costs of repair in the future.
            Beyond project completion, Gujarat has worked to consolidate
            its capacity for and progress in monitoring road condition
            data and prioritizing road works on that basis.
            Institutional and administrative capacity-building should be
            carried out in step with the readiness of the target agency
            to internalize it. The ability to improve capacity on
            multiple fronts such as planning, procurement, contract
            management, and environmental and social safeguards may
            differ from one road agency to another, and may take more
            than one project cycle to materialize. As road agencies
            evolve from being providers of roads services to managers of
            increasingly outsourced functions, it is essential that core
            competencies are retained and strengthened to ensure
            sustainable management of the road network. The core
            competencies relating to planning, technical design, road
            management systems, procurement, contract management and
            environmental and social safeguards have been impacted to
            different extents in Gujarat and Karnataka due to
            outsourcing to consulting firms, staff turnover, staff
            depletion and lack of follow-up training. The roads agency
            should lead the way in creating a productive working
            relationship with other entities involved in the
            implementation of roads projects. A culture of partnership
            and cooperation was demonstrated in Gujarat between the
            roads and buildings department, road works contractors and
            supervising engineers which minimized disputes and speeded
            up implementation. A knowledge product that seeks to cover a
            subject that has already been well studied must provide
            clear justification of its likely added value.

India - Gujarat State Highway Project, and
            Karnataka State Highways Improvement Project

16579489.trustfund:
TF026215-FINANCING OF AUSAID SECONDMENTS,TF034775-INDIA - NATIONAL HIGHWAYS,TF036231-INDIA - NATIONAL HIGHWAYS,TF040057-INDIA - APPRAISAL, SUPERVISION,
            RESEARCH, PREPARATION.  GUJARAT STATE H
16579489.majtheme: Social protection and risk management,Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Urban development

abstracts.cdata!:
This result profile talks about highway
            improvements in Gujarat, India. Fast-growing Gujarat
            Province faced economic decline, poor road conditions were
            made worse by a growing number of vehicles on the roads, and
            growth slowed. But a highway project financed by the
            International Bank for Reconstruction helped turn this rural
            area around by upgrading roads and maintenance. As a result,
            businesses thrived, agricultural production increased,
            students and teachers attended school more easily and
            frequently, and health improved as transport to and from the
            Gujarat Province became faster and safer.

display_title.display_title:
Gujarat, India, highway
            improvements : Carreteras rurales en India

repnme.cdata!:
Opening the rural hinterlands : Gujarat
            state highway

abstracts.cdata!:
Despite a once fast-growing economy,
            Gujarat province was facing an economic decline that was not
            being helped by its poor road conditions and a growing
            population of car users. The impact on people's lives
            in this rural area turned around with implementation of the
            International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)
            financed highway project that upgraded road conditions and
            maintenance. Businesses thrived, agricultural production
            increased, students and teachers attended school more easily
            and frequently, and health improved as transport to and from
            Gujarat province became faster and safer.

docna.cdata!:
Opening the rural hinterlands : Gujarat
            state highway

Opening the rural hinterlands :
            Gujarat state highway

23159504.trustfund:
TF026215-FINANCING OF AUSAID SECONDMENTS,TF034775-INDIA - NATIONAL HIGHWAYS,TF036231-INDIA - NATIONAL HIGHWAYS,TF040057-INDIA - APPRAISAL, SUPERVISION,
            RESEARCH, PREPARATION.  GUJARAT STATE H

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Gujarat State Highway
            Project for India are as follows: outcome was highly
            satisfactory, risk to the development outcome was low, the
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was rated as highly satisfactory. Some of the
            lessons learned included: 1) careful design and cost review
            at the pre-bidding stage will lead to lower costs of the
            works; 2) agency's strong commitment will also lead to
            cost reductions; 3) strong contract management by the
            Employer is indispensable to minimize delay and keep
            implementation within the contractually stipulated time
            frame; 4) a good management consultant supporting the
            overall function of the employer will help the employer to
            enhance his contract management and capacity building; 5)
            the success of the Environmental Management Unit was due to
            strong consultant's guidance in the preparation stage
            and repeated training programs during implementation; 6)
            repeated consultation is likely to bring about stakeholder
            satisfaction and contribute to the project success; 7) a
            principal rule for success of a project is that strong
            continued leadership and commitment of the implementing
            agency's top management is a key factor; 8) supervision
            of periodic maintenance by the implementing agency is a good
            hands-on technical capacity building opportunity to enhance
            its role as the owner of the network; and 9) performance
            indicators for measuring the outcome of institutional
            capacity enhancement need careful attention to capture the essence.

9735662.majtheme: Rural development,Environment and natural resource management

repnme.cdata!:
India - Gujarat State Highway Project -
            sectoral environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This sectoral environmental assessment
            (SEA) of the Gujarat State Highway Project performs an
            environmental screening of the project corridors; provides a
            plan for mitigating and monitoring the impacts resulting
            from road rehabilitation, construction, and operation; and
            designs and operates an implementing agency. These measures
            mitigate impacts: To control dust, spray water at mixing
            sites, on temporary roads, and at regular intervals; use
            coal ash with 30 percent water content; cover vehicles; seal
            mixing equipment; install dust-removal devices; use proper
            road surface runoff and drainage; replace roadside trees;
            and encourage afforestation. To control air pollution,
            conform to emissions standards; distance asphalt-mixing
            sites; and regularly monitor worker health and emissions
            levels. To control noise, enforce noise standards; enforce
            worker airplug and helmet use; limit work hours; monitor
            vehicle and machine maintenance; and employ sound barriers,
            berms, and other soundproofing materials. Use retaining
            walls to prevent floods, and excavate to replace area of
            water bodies. To improve drainage, minimize earth movements;
            avoid contamination from fuel and lubricants; dispose of
            cement and steel reinforcements; and replace or relocate
            wells. Contain water erosion on soil by replanting and
            reseeding. Fill in borrow pits holding contaminants.
            Retaining walls and barriers will minimize cross sections
            while protecting flora. Phase II addresses specifically the
            wild ass crossing on Viramgam - Halvad corridor, sets the
            institutional and legal framework, and presents the public
            participation programme (vols. 5-10).

India - Gujarat State Highway Project -
